book.title: The Great Gatsby
book.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book.summary: A novel set in the Jazz Age that tells the story of Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

book.author: George Orwell
book.summary: A dystopian novel about totalitarian surveillance, censorship, and the dangers of absolute political power.

book.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book.author: Harper Lee
book.summary: A story about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South, told through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

book.title: The Catcher in the Rye
book.author: J.D. Salinger
book.summary: Follows the life of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who struggles with alienation and identity in postwar America.

book.title: Pride and Prejudice
book.author: Jane Austen
book.summary: A romantic novel exploring manners, upbringing, morality, and marriage in 19th-century England.

book.title: Moby Dick
book.author: Herman Melville
book.summary: The quest of Captain Ahab to seek revenge on the giant white whale that bit off his leg.

book.title: War and Peace
book.author: Leo Tolstoy
book.summary: A sweeping narrative about Russian society during the Napoleonic wars, blending history and fiction.

book.title: The Hobbit
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.summary: The adventure of Bilbo Baggins, who joins a group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

book.title: The Lord of the Rings
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.summary: An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron, the Dark Lord.

book.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
book.author: J.K. Rowling
book.summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the young wizard and his adventures at Hogwarts.

book.title: The Da Vinci Code
book.author: Dan Brown
book.summary: A thriller combining art, history, and conspiracy as Robert Langdon uncovers secrets hidden by the Catholic Church.

book.title: The Alchemist
book.author: Paulo Coelho
book.summary: A philosophical novel about a shepherd named Santiago who dreams of finding treasure in the pyramids of Egypt.

book.title: Brave New World
book.author: Aldous Huxley
book.summary: A dystopian story about a future society driven by technology, conditioning, and a loss of individuality.

book.title: The Kite Runner
book.author: Khaled Hosseini
book.summary: A story of friendship and betrayal in Afghanistan, exploring themes of guilt, redemption, and family ties.

book.title: Crime and Punishment
book.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
book.summary: The psychological journey of Raskolnikov, a man who commits murder and struggles with guilt and morality.

book.title: The Brothers Karamazov
book.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
book.summary: A philosophical drama about morality, free will, and faith, told through the lives of three brothers.

book.title: Anna Karenina
book.author: Leo Tolstoy
book.summary: The tragic love affair of Anna Karenina, set against the backdrop of Russian high society.

book.title: Les Misérables
book.author: Victor Hugo
book.summary: The story of Jean Valjean’s redemption and struggles in 19th-century France.

book.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
book.author: Alexandre Dumas
book.summary: A tale of betrayal, imprisonment, and ultimate revenge by Edmond Dantès.

book.title: Dracula
book.author: Bram Stoker
book.summary: The classic gothic horror novel introducing Count Dracula and the vampire myth.

book.title: Frankenstein
book.author: Mary Shelley
book.summary: The story of Victor Frankenstein, who creates a living being that spirals out of control.

book.title: Don Quixote
book.author: Miguel de Cervantes
book.summary: A comic tale about a nobleman who believes he is a knight and sets out on misguided adventures.

book.title: The Odyssey
book.author: Homer
book.summary: The epic journey of Odysseus as he attempts to return home after the Trojan War.

book.title: The Iliad
book.author: Homer
book.summary: The story of the Trojan War, focusing on the wrath of Achilles.

book.title: Meditations
book.author: Marcus Aurelius
book.summary: A collection of Stoic philosophy and personal reflections by the Roman emperor.

book.title: Republic
book.author: Plato
book.summary: A philosophical dialogue exploring justice, the ideal state, and the philosopher-king.

book.title: Nicomachean Ethics
book.author: Aristotle
book.summary: A treatise on ethics, virtue, and the path to the good life.

book.title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
book.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
book.summary: A philosophical novel introducing ideas like the Übermensch and eternal recurrence.

book.title: Beyond Good and Evil
book.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
book.summary: A critique of traditional morality and philosophy, advancing Nietzsche’s radical views.

book.title: The Stranger
book.author: Albert Camus
book.summary: An existential novel about Meursault, a man who is detached from society and its norms.

book.title: The Plague
book.author: Albert Camus
book.summary: A novel exploring human resilience and solidarity during a deadly epidemic in Oran, Algeria.

book.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
book.author: Gabriel García Márquez
book.summary: A magical realist saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

book.title: Love in the Time of Cholera
book.author: Gabriel García Márquez
book.summary: The story of enduring love between Fermina Daza and Florentino Ariza over decades.

book.title: Fahrenheit 451
book.author: Ray Bradbury
book.summary: A dystopian novel where books are banned and firemen burn any that are found.

book.title: Dune
book.author: Frank Herbert
book.summary: A science fiction epic about politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet Arrakis.

book.title: Foundation
book.author: Isaac Asimov
book.summary: A sci-fi series about the fall of a galactic empire and the science of psychohistory.

book.title: I, Robot
book.author: Isaac Asimov
book.summary: A collection of short stories exploring robotics and the Three Laws of Robotics.

book.title: Neuromancer
book.author: William Gibson
book.summary: The novel that pioneered cyberpunk, featuring artificial intelligence and cyberspace.

book.title: Snow Crash
book.author: Neal Stephenson
book.summary: A cyberpunk novel exploring the Metaverse, hacking, and a digital virus.

book.title: Cryptonomicon
book.author: Neal Stephenson
book.summary: A novel weaving together WWII codebreakers and modern cryptography entrepreneurs.

book.title: The Road
book.author: Cormac McCarthy
book.summary: A bleak post-apocalyptic journey of a father and son struggling to survive.

book.title: Blood Meridian
book.author: Cormac McCarthy
book.summary: A violent Western about the Glanton gang and themes of destiny and chaos.

book.title: Beloved
book.author: Toni Morrison
book.summary: A haunting novel about slavery, memory, and the supernatural presence of a dead child.

book.title: Song of Solomon
book.author: Toni Morrison
book.summary: A multigenerational story exploring African-American identity and folklore.

book.title: Invisible Man
book.author: Ralph Ellison
book.summary: A novel about race, identity, and invisibility in mid-20th-century America.

book.title: Native Son
book.author: Richard Wright
book.summary: The story of Bigger Thomas and systemic racism in Chicago during the 1930s.

book.title: Things Fall Apart
book.author: Chinua Achebe
book.summary: The story of Okonkwo, an Igbo leader, and the impact of colonialism in Nigeria.

book.title: Half of a Yellow Sun
book.author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
book.summary: A novel about the Nigerian Civil War and the personal stories intertwined with it.

book.title: Americanah
book.author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
book.summary: A story about love, identity, and migration between Nigeria, the UK, and the US.
